SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SALESFORCE ORDER MANAGEMENT
Customize an Order Management Flow

It’s common to customize Order Management flows to set values for price book entries, tailor how discounts are handled, or work with Omnichannel Inventory (OCI). Use these guidelines to make common customizations. Some of the flows described are available only with a Starter or Growth license.

To use an Order Management flow, copy the flow template and then customize it as needed.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Flows, and then select Flows.
Click New Flow.
Select a template, and click Create.
Click Save As, and for Flow Label, enter a unique name.
Customize the flow as needed.
Click Save.
If you’re ready to activate the flow, click Activate.
If you’re using even exchanges on an org that supports multiple currencies, customize the Even Exchange flow to set the CurrencyIsoCode value on price book entries.
Open your Even Exchange flow.
In the list of Create Records elements, select Pricebook_Entry.
In the Set Field Values for the Price Book Entry section, click Add Field.
For Field, enter CurrencyIsoCode.
For Value, enter {!Get_Order_Summary.CurrencyIsoCode}.
Click Done.
Click Save.
By default, the Discount Item flow calls the Adjust Order Item Summary action with an allocatedItemsChangeOrderType value of InFulfillment. That process creates a separate change order for order items that are in the process of being fulfilled. To use a different process, customize the flow to set a different value. See Flow Core Action for Order Management: Adjust Order Item Summaries Submit for the available values.
When the Adjust action or API resource is called, the default value is Disallowed.
If you use Salesforce Omnichannel Inventory, make these customizations.
These customizations are applicable only with an Order Management Starter or Growth license.
In the Even Exchange flow, set the applyOCI and useLocationGroups variables to true. The default is false.
In the Order on Behalf Of flow, set the applyOCI and useLocationGroups variables to true. The default is false.
The Order on Behalf Of flow doesn’t create inventory reservations or restrict orders for unavailable products. It only retrieves and displays inventory availability data.
In the Reship Order flow, set the applyOCI variable to true. The default is false.
The Cancel Item flow, Return Item flow, and RMA flows support adding fees. The Connect in Apex, Connect REST API, and flow core actions for cancels and returns also support fees. To charge fees for cancels or returns, implement custom processes or flows as described in Order Management: Charge Return Fees.
